org.jetel.data.parser

Class XLSParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.parser.AbstractParser
      • org.jetel.data.parser.XLSParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JExcelXLSDataParser, XLSXDataParser

    public abstract class XLSParser
extends AbstractParser
    Parses data from xls file. Order of method calling:
    • init(DataRecordMetadata)
    • setSheetName(String) or setSheetNumber(int) - optional
    • setFirstRow(int) - optional
    • setMappingType(int) - optional
    • setCloverFields(int) - optional (depending on mapping type)
    • setXlsFields(int) - optional (depending on mapping type)
    • setMetadataRow(int) - optional (depending on mapping type)
    • setDataSource(InputStream)
    • getNames() - optional
    • getNext(DataRecord)
    • close()
    Since:
    Jan 16, 2007

      • setMappingType

        public void setMappingType(int mappingType)
        Sets mapping type between xls columns and metadata
        Parameters:
        mappingType: -
        • NO_METADATA_INFO - cell order corresponds with field order in metadata
        • ONLY_CLOVER_FIELDS - cells are read in order of clover fields
        • CLOVER_FIELDS_AND_XLS_NUMBERS - mapping between corresponding fields and cells
        • CLOVER_FIELDS_AND_XLS_NAMES - mapping between corresponding fields and cells
        • MAP_NAMES - finds fields in metadata with the same names as names in xls sheet

      • getMetadataRow

        public int getMetadataRow()
        Returns:
        number, which was set by setMetadataRow method

      • nextL3Source

        public boolean nextL3Source()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Used to move to the next subsection of an input source where applicable. Example: For XLS files each sheet is considered a separate subsection, upon reaching end of sheet getNext() call returns null, this may be followed by a nextL3Source() call; if the call succeeds reading may continue. Implementation for parsers that do not deal with data inputs with multiple subsections should always return false. Naming explanation: level 1 (L1) - all inputs to be processed, level 2 (L2) - individual inputs in L1, level 3 (L3) - individual subsections in L2.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if no more subsections are available

      • getPreferredDataSourceType

        public Parser.DataSourceType getPreferredDataSourceType()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Parser can request specific data source type, which is preferred to be passed into Parser.setDataSource(Object) method. This is intended just a hint for source provider, so other types of source should be expected.
        Specified by:
        getPreferredDataSourceType in interface Parser
        Overrides:
        getPreferredDataSourceType in class AbstractParser
